markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Machete](/Weapons.aspx?ID=516)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Deadly d8" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=570" />
<trait label="Sweep" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=708" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 18, [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 120 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Favored Weapon** [Aminara](/Deities.aspx?ID=664), [Demon Bringers](/Deities.aspx?ID=230), [Kazutal](/Deities.aspx?ID=350)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 7 sp

**Damage** 1d6 S

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Martial

**Group** [Sword](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=15)
</row>

</column>

---

This medium-length sword has a wide blade and long grip. Though it is typically used to hack through heavy foliage, the machete can also be used as a deadly weapon.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-15" />
name: Machete
